Author: Benedict Uy
Review:
This temple is known for its 1000 Kannon statues. The wooden sculptures were all carved by hand and each one looks slightly different even though they all had the same items in each of their hands. There is also the main larger statue in the middle of all the smaller ones. Apart from the Kannon there were also statues of the other deities with English descriptions.
You need to take off your shoes but they provide bags for you to carry it around.
The grounds outside is quite nice, with a pond and shrine around the ground.
It is a bit out of the way but you can catch a bus to get here and it is quite a sight to behold.

Author: Edward T
Review:
Magnificent. Easy access from Kyoto station by bus. Purchase a day pass of ¬•500 and you can visit a few places in Kyoto. Bus 100, 206, 208 from Kyoto station will take you there. Alight at Shichi-jo dori and follow the sign board to the entrance of Sanjusangen-do.

Sanjusangen-do is a Buddhist temple at Higashiyama district of Kyoto. Officially known as 'Rengeo-in', it means hall of lotus king. The name of the temple refers to Hall with thirty three space between columns, reflects the architectural construction. It houses thousand armed Kannon Statues made of Japanese cypress clad with gold leaf.

A must-see temple when you are in Kyoto.

From the same bus stop you may continue to take the bus to Kiyomizu-dera.

Author: Don Vittorio
Review:
This shrine is a smaller area and the outside ground is not so impressive. But it is a large open area and good for taking photos. There are sakura trees and if you are lucky they are in bloom when you visit.
The main beauty of this shrine is inside the main building. It is one of the most impressive and striking displays I've seen. Thousands of golden Buddha statues. It is such a peaceful and powerful place to visit and experience. You can feel the history. They have English descriptions of the different deities on display. Unfortunately photography inside the building is prohibited. But you must visit here.

Author: Rob Mohr
Review: Great history and story from this temple. One of my favorites in Kyoto! You can't take photos inside, but it's amazing.

Author: Luke Phang
Review: I didn't know why we decided to visit this place, but I guess it's because they have 1001 statues of Buddha in this long hall. Other than that there's nothing much, but staring into 1001 statues of Buddha can be quite an experience. I felt awed at the sheer number of the statues but if you're not someone who can appreciate works of art and labour then you might want to skip this place. It's not that easy to reach and there's are not many other attractions around this place.

Author: KIRAN SAWANT
Review: iconic buddhist temple. saw lot of Indian god/ goddess name like  Vishnu deva, Laxmi devta, Indra

Author: J Momoko
Review:
I don't know how to describe this place. Just a must see spot in Kyoto or Japan.
You may find your favorite one out of 1001 statues there.

Author: Momo Tsukino
Review: This is one of the best places I have visited in Japan. Photos are not allowed to be taken once inside as the Buddhas are very sacred. You will notice that the faces of the statues are different from each other which means they were carved by different people.

Author: Joanie
Review: It's very beautiful and unique and quite underrated. The only downside is that you have to pay ¬•600 yet you can't take any photos. But I guess we have to respect that. Really recommended.

Author: Kevin Zhao
Review: Beautiful Budda statues but we can't take photos. There are 1001 of them. There is a little descriptions for couple main statues. Good place to worship, pray, and clear your mind.

Author: Edmund Yip
Review: This is one of the places which really put me to awe so easily. This temple has thousands of ornate statues of Kanon and visitors to this temple are prayerful and quiet as they pass through the main hall. No pictures allowed of the inside and the small entry fee is worth the while.

Author: David Wu
Review: Cool temple to visit the inside was worth taking a look at! No photography allowed inside but the walk was very peaceful!

Author: Ian Gore
Review:
Probably the most educational temple visit ever. There are detailed signs explaining the faces and significance of all the statues, of which there are many to begin with.

A friendly stranger even reminded me that I shouldn't be praying here like it was a shrine. Woops, lol.

This temple is very long and every inch of that space is put to use.

Author: Matthew Khew
Review: Spectacular Buddhist temple that enshrined 1000 statues of Arvalokoteshvara Boddhisatva. The temple‚Äôs main hall was designed in long shape in 33 partitions. ‚ÄúSanjusangendo‚Äù which literally means the 33 halls temple. The official temple name is ËìÆËèØÁéãÈô¢, the lotus lord temple

Author: Christophe Abbinanti
Review: Amaaaaazing! The garden is great but the most interesting point is the interior. The 500 statues with the huge statue in the middle of these are just incredible. I never seen something like that before. Highly recommended!

Author: CAI GAN XIAN Lucas
Review: Impressive and powerful temple. The most impressive feature is the display of 1000 life size of the goddess Kannon. Amazing. Impressive. And the garden is so beautiful.

Author: William Wei
Review: The grounds are nice here but the truly cool part of this temple is the 1000 Buddhas inside the building. Quite shocking just how many of them there are inside! No pictures allowed inside the actual temple part though.

Author: David Del Sacramento
Review: This is one of the most amazing temple that I saw in Japan. I can say is the first one in my Japan amazing temples.

Author: Taylor
Review: What a wonderful and beautiful place to spend some time. The amount of artistry and history is amazing. So much to take in. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Thank you. I highly recommend a visit!

Author: Alfredo Hernandez
Review: Very peaceful and beautiful temple. You walk down the main hall where 10 rows of 100 statues of Kannon are displayed. The main statue in the center of the hall is impressive. In addition, there are about 30 statues of different deities, with a brief description in english. No pictures are allowed. A walk in the garden is recommended at the end of the visit. Highly recommended visit and it‚Äôs in front of the Kyoto National Museum, which is also worth a visit.

Author: Hemant Mishra
Review: You‚Äôll be charged 600 Yen as a entrance fee and it‚Äôs worth going inside to see all 1001 buddha statue and the huge Buddha statue inside. You‚Äôll learn about different types of gods in buddhism. Camera use is not allowed inside. Surrounding garden is beautiful.

Author: ester rufariza
Review: When you walk inside you will mesmerized by the thousands of gold colored budha statue as a representative of the kanon (budha that is believe have a 1000 hand cmiiw). Its also an architecture masterpiece of a building from 700's of masehi. This old temple still well manage and have a long history and play important role back than. A very worth place to pay a visit

Author: Jos√© Ant√≥nio Costa
Review: Fabulous place , you pay to go in and you can not take pictures , but it is worthy

Author: Melissa Vania Adelina (Meme)
Review: A supeeeeer nice place with history inside. You could buy some charms there, and even draw your lucky rate. Try it and you'll feel likes Japanese teenager üòãüòã

Author: earthwaterangel 85
Review: A very solemn place and full of positive energy... inside of the temple you will see a thousand golden statues of thousand-armed ¬†Kannon, the goddess of mercy and you will also see guardian deities.

Author: Tossapol Boonlert-uthai
Review: You have to go and see by yourself because there is no allow to take a photo in the building. It's very beautiful 1,001 Bhudas.

Author: Makoa Fautua
Review: The life-sized wooden statues within the temple are amazing to see, unique detail can be found in each. They ask to remove your shoes before entering, and no photos/food to be taken inside.

Author: Richard Perry
Review: The outside is honestly dull, grey shingle and a few plants, but take off your shoes and go inside the massive hall and you will be wowed at thousands of golden statues that run the full length. Sadly no photos allowed, but it's impressive, also have some 100 yen coins if want to light a candle or burn some incense.

Author: Josh Middleton
Review: Such a cool place‚Äîone of my favorite Asian temple experiences. We learned about it through the New York Times‚Äô 36 Hours in Kyoto, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint.

Author: somsom Chatnapa
Review: Inside was so beautiful but couldn't take pic bcz it's now allowed as it's Japan nationals treasures. Recommended to visit there. Don't miss if you go Kyoto.

Author: Deb Tryzbiak
Review: Today when we visited, we got to experience the annual archery contest. It was crowded, but so much fun. There were food stalls on the temple grounds which made it very festive. Normally this is a quiet temple with a beautiful pond area surrounded by cherry blossom trees (gorgeous during cherry blossom season). We were able to see the last archers and were given free entrance to the temple. We saw the 1,000 statues which is very neat to see all the different faces. The monks were also given blessings over anyone who came through to remove evil and provide healing, especially for headaches. It was a great experience overall.

Author: Matt Shaw
Review: Absolutely staggering on the inside. 1000 exquisite buddist statues with some dating back to 1200's. No photos allowed inside unfortunately. Seriously one of the most fascinating and breathtaking things I have seen. Well worth it.

Author: Kyoto Dream Trips
Review:
Today, while in Kyoto City, I visited the famous Sanj≈´sangen-d≈ç temple. Although there were not as many visitors due to the Corano virus, I did spot several foreigners. My main interest today was the Kawazu sakura (Ê≤≥Ê¥•Ê°ú) an early-blooming version. The Kawazu sakura flowers‚Äô outstanding characteristic is that they are large and pink. When the trees are in peak bloom, they look brilliant.The main sakura tree in the garden near the pond had already developed some green leaves. Still, it was a worthwhile visit. Unfortunate the pond was under maintenance and not a pretty sight.
It's been a while since I was here and, I noticed that the facilities have been upgraded.

Author: Tracy Sung
Review:
It was a little underwhelming for us, but we loved the peaceful gardens and the pop of bright orange from the darker style wood. When we went, no pictures were allowed inside, but the golden statues inside were absolutely stunning. Recommend if you're in the area.

Note: Visited prior to Covid, so things may be different.

Author: KICHI
Review:
„Åì„Åì„Å´Êù•„Åü„ÇâËá™ÂàÜ„Å´‰ºº„Å¶„ÇãË¶≥Èü≥Êßò„ÇíÊé¢„Åó„Å°„ÇÉ„ÅÑ„Åæ„Åô„Å≠„ÄÇ1000‰Ωì„Åã„ÇâÊé¢„Åô„ÅÆ„ÅØ„Åª„ÅºÁÑ°ÁêÜ„Åß„Åô„Åå...
"33" is in Japanese Sanjusan. Sanjusangendo is called so because this temple is a hall with thirty-three spaces between columns. The official name of Sanjusangendo is Rengeoin temple.
In front of the temple hall, there is Natural Springs for Worshippers. This is called night sobbing springs because the flow of the spring sounds like a person sobbing. On the other hand, it is said that visiting this spring helps to stop babies crying at night.
The hall of the temple is about 120 meter long. The gallery on the western side of the hall is famous for the annual Toshiya Festival (canceled this year). Archers shoot arrows the length of the hall. It seems so difficult to hit the target!
This temple houses 1001 statues of the 1000-armed Kannon (Buddhist deity). The largest seated Kannon is National Treasure, and is flanked on either side by 500 smaller Kannon images, nearly lined up in rows.  It is said that there is one statue whose face is just like you, and if you find the statue, you have good luck!

Author: Armando Landin
Review: The main hall with 1,000 gold-leafed Kannon statues and 28 deities is more impressive than we'd imagined. It's all the more impressive that these intricate sculptures have survived century upon century. Although photography is not allowed within the main hall, there are some nice picture opportunities outside in the garden area.

Author: √Ånderson Godoy
Review: Very nice for what it is. It is pretty large and filled to the brim with sculptures. It may get a bit repetitive, but it is worth seeing at least once. Especially, since the main sculptures are really full of detail and have very interesting expressions and bodily features.

Author: Annie Sobol
Review: This temple is amazing üò≤ the hand carved wood statues covered in gold leaf, it‚Äôs probably thousands of them inside the temple. Each god featured was uniquely hand carved with a different theme. Overall, highly recommend a visit to this truly unique statues and temple.

Author: Chris Moore (Momentum Realtor)
Review: Simply amazing place to a glimpse at a moment in time with those statues. Couldn‚Äôt take any pictures inside. Pretty amazing history on each one of the Buddhist deities. Something created in the 12th century and in great condition. Bought a couple of nice souvenirs and would highly recommend to anyone in Kyoto.

Author: Nathan Fischer
Review: You won't be able to take pictures inside, but it's an impressive display of 1000 gold statues, all similar but each uniquely hand made. The temple is a historic archery sight as well. Worth the trip.

Author: Adrian Crumley
Review: Possibly my favorite temple. No photos inside but an unbelievable amount of detail and atmosphere inside. Please be quiet inside and soak it in üôè

Author: Jyota Sasanishi
Review: Quite amazing for all 1000 statues crafted to be erected inside the temple. There were several spots to pray and light candles. If you're inclined to do that, there are people walking by to continue touring. Cannot take pictures, but you can visualize it in your head once you seen it.

Author: M√°rio Santos
Review: 600 yen as a bit too much but the inside experience was amazing, many statues of buddhist deities and a huge statue of buda also the temple is historically connected with archery

Author: Mohana Ram
Review: Awestruck moment. Such a connection between different cultures. Photography was not allowed inside the hall. That will be a huge surprise for you, when you visit.

Author: Rajeev Kapoor
Review: Awesome statues and depictions inside the temple. So different from other temples. The gardens are basic but the temple steals the show.

Author: Bal√°zs S√°f√°r
Review:
This place has a unique mood. I loved it! The statues are beautiful and there is no two identical. The main Buddha is breathtaking. I think it is a must visit place in Kyoto.
You cannot take any photo, so please respect this and only memorize with your eyes.

Author: Naresh Anisetty
Review: Amazing place, 1000 warriors & main Buddha statue, Dieties so relatable to Hinduism.. Must see in Kyoto.

Author: Ek Kee Lee
Review: A place where you can learn a lot about the statutes.There are details about the each Buddha amazing place

Author: Aryan Blr
Review:
Walked down here after Kiyomizu Dera.
Absolutely stunning. Deep insights into Japanese buddhism heritage.

I wish they had an English version of the picture book in the souvenir shop.

Author: Varsam Kurnia
Review: The display of statues was amazing, a quiet serene grandeur and the ground was pleasant to stroll around.

Author: kylie Tsuki
Review: This place is one of my most favorite places in Kyoto. I grew up running around in the backyard of this place. This shrine always gives me a sense of tranquility. In the neighborhood around this shrine is like a real downtown Kyoto. You‚Äôll see small mom&pop businesses and shops. I‚Äôd recommend to take a walk around the neighborhood to meet real local Kyoto people. Bring thick pair of socks and jacket to visit this shrine in winter. Floor is as cold as ice.

Author: S. V
Review: I saw Ashur(Ahura Mazda), the Persian God there. It was a great museum.

Author: Karen Lapniten-Bosaing (karenkariana)
Review:
Visited this place two days before Christmas.

The place doesn't allow you to take pictures inside the temple but you can walk around the temple and take a few snaps. Inside, you can see the statues lined up and the image of Kannon in the middle. It's really amazing so I recommend you to visit it.

The entrance fee for adults is ¬•600 while children is ¬•300

Author: Dinara Coaching Mendesheva
Review: Amazing place. To see so many Buddha statues in one place is breathtaking. It is a very sacred place. Highly recommend. They do not accept cards. Make sure you have cash to buy souvenirs or light a candle.

Author: Tim Bade
Review: This is one of the best and most memorable temples I have visited in all of Japan. My only regret is not taking pictures but the statues are so moving and frightening that once inside, you are completely deterred from going against their wishes! Respect the ways of the past so we can prosper forward.

Author: linda s
Review:
Very glad that we visited here.
As they don't allow photo taking,  it may be less popular with non locals but I highly recommend a visit if you are in Kyoto.

The 1001 statue of goddess of mercy is breathtaking and Serene.

Author: Georgina Shippey
Review:
One of the best temples in Kyoto, every statue is unique! Wear thick socks in winter.
A haiku, from the perspective of a Kannon statue:
hands pressed together
a thousand years I have prayed
in complete stillness

Author: Tek Jin LIEW
Review:
Old temple with a lot of Kannon statues and protecting gods in the main hall.
The statues are quite impressive and well preserved, especially the ones with "glass bead"  eyes.
In my opinion, a temple that doesn't get enough recognition and appreciation of the Kyoto tourism authority and tourists alike.

Author: Joe Minuti
Review: Fascinating shrine with a thousand hand carved from Japanese Cyprus deities.

Author: Rishav Dhar
Review: Wonderful place. Much less touristy than other temples and more spiritual. Very good labelling in English for tourists to follow the cultural significance.

Author: James Rockall
Review: No photos are allowed of the inside of the hall but an amazing collection of statues of various gods. It is very old and would benefit from a renovation. Continuous incense and candle smoke has left the statutes rather blackened.

Author: Empty B
Review:
Worth the 600 yen entry.  The scale of the building and number of Buddhas is hard to describe.  No photography inside.
The grounds are also very pretty.

Author: Sun Moon
Review:
One of my favorite temple in Kyoto. It doesn‚Äôt allow taking photos so you won‚Äôt find the Instagram crazy tourists there.
Look carefully at the wooden statues‚Äô faces, each one has some unique facial features. There‚Äôs a common belief that it‚Äôs possible to see the face of the person we love the most among the various depictions. The temple is also known for its rather original omamori, or protective charms which is also called a zuts√π f≈´ji. This charm to ward off headaches contains a piece of a willow branch, as well as a sutra that asks Goddess Kannon to heal the holder of their afflictions.

Author: Bob Ross
Review: The best temple I ever been to! The buddhas are exceptional (no photos are allowed sadly) is still worth it!

Author: Cassandra Sim
Review: Well worth the entrance fee. Brought my Buddhist mum here and she was extremely impressed. The sheer number of Guanyin/Kannon statues is astounding! Highly recommended

Author: Yusuke Kowalewski
Review: One of the most beautiful temples in Japan. There's are 1000 statues of "Senju-Kannon"

Author: David Dinus
Review: Turning the corner and seeing those 1000 gold statues is just absolutely gorgeous. Definitely a must see.

Author: Tom Shahriari
Review: Beautiful garden and the interior is very interesting and educational.   Hundreds of magnificent sculptures.

Author: James Chainey
Review: If you like things like museums and statues (and I do), then this is unmissable. The grounds outside are wonderful in their own right but obviously the main attraction is the 1000 statues. I've never seen anything like it. Remarkable

Author: Beinghampus
Review: Amazing tempe and garden. Take your time to read about all the statues while walking and make sure you get a notebook signed by the monks.

Author: Sekhar Visvanathan
Review: A beautiful temple. The statues inside are worth seeing. Indians can relate many statues with Hindu deities

Author: Rich Goh
Review: Wow!! Is all I can say when u see it with ur own eyes. Photo taking not allowed inside. But it's a must go

Author: Julien Dyminski
Review: Beautiful statues collection, just know the place can be very crowded, and you are not allowed to take pictures inside of the buildings.

Author: Lina Movchan
Review: Absolutely mesmerizing visit. I am glad that photographing is not allowed inside, it makes you appreciate this captivating work even more.

Author: Sergi Carneros
Review: As always in many Japanese places, you can't take photographs inside, so they can sell you photobooks and postcards in the official shop at the end of the visit. Anyway, the temple is impressive so it worth a visit.

Author: Gotham P
Review: The spiritual energy at this place is strong and resonating. Sculptures and the stories behind them are truly transformative

Author: Omri Gilhar
Review: My wife and I had a great time at the temple, the statues were amazing and very detailed.

Author: Jaroslav Nov√°k
Review: Impressive big hall with statues and a large statue in the middle, photography is not allowed inside and entry is about 600 yen, the visit will take about 20 minutes, besides the statues there is a nice display of japanese archery which is the temple's tradition

Author: Terrence Oh
Review: There are lots of Buddhist statue in the temple. Unfortunately we're forbid to take pictures

Author: Gwen Aiello
Review: Beautifull temple with 1001 bouddhas really liked the place.

Author: Sneha Kumar
Review: Mesmerizing and a very beautiful shrine. You feel calm as soon as you enter the premises. Elegant statue of Kanon. Must visit place

Author: Day Vid
Review:
Amazing experience!
The sculptures, the hall and the whole place is well kept, clean and inviting.
In addition, it is highly prepared for tourists.

Author: Abd El Haleem Mohamed Abo El Hamd
Review: Few minutes visit would be nice to check one of the biggest temples with lots of monuments

Author: Antonio Guevara
Review: It is amazing to be there,  and see that each figure is different,  it should be a must if you are in kyoto

Author: Keith Bauman
Review: Interesting and very popular place.

Author: keefe ‚Äúcloudie‚Äù hayashi
Review: A collection of 1,001 exquisitely carved Goddess of Mercy statues, the main one seated several metres tall, flanked on both sides by 1,000 standing Goddesses of Mercy. Each with 11 faces and 25 hands. To help the suffering.

Author: Eugene M
Review: It is rather hard to convey the solemnity and atmosphere of this temple. One thousand statues are a sight to behold. No photos inside ( which isn‚Äôt necessarily a bad thing).

Author: jacqueline bonn
Review: For me the most beautiful and interesting temple in Kyoto. Don‚Äôt understand why it is not UNESCO heritage..

Author: Dina Gohil
Review: An unexpected gem. The level of detail insane and feeling you get was humbling. A must see. One of my favourites in Japan.

Author: Amnon Nachshon
Review: Interesting display of 1000 statues presented really close together. It is followed by another small museum display with various bow related items which was interesting and well done too.

Author: Paul Shotts
Review: Amazing temple with its 1001 buddhas

Author: Hugo Cisternas
Review: Even while heavy rain this day, the experience was great, amazing statue of buddha.

Author: Isabel Rehra
Review: Amazing place but inside no photos allowed. Still definitely worth the visit

Author: Pavel Pekun
Review: It's just OK to visit ones for 600 yen. No photo allowed is just stupid.

Author: Ruben Royackers
Review: An amazing place, all the Buddha's are quite a phenomenon to see! Can't take pictures inside however

Author: Sharon S.
Review: The hundreds of statues were worth the visit and the fact it was off the tour bus route. Save time to check out the museum across the street.

Author: payal juthani
Review: Spectacular temple. One of the best I have seen. MUST VISIT!!

Author: Carla G
Review: The best, it's really impressive. I could spend 3 hours only contemplating it.

Author: Patrick Franc
Review: In my 50+ visits to Japan and having served as unofficial host/ guide more than several times to family members and friends this is my #1 ‚Äúmust-do‚Äù in Japan. Positively breathtaking in every way.

Author: Jarko
Review: Very beautiful temple with impressive statues. Unfortunately you're not able to tzke pictures of the inside, but just witnessing the craftmenship is already great too.
